page.title: 01The Cycling Proficiency Test
page.content: Police Constable Cadwallader is one of our three local policemen. Each week he gives up his lunch hour and comes into school as our cycling instructor for the proficiency test. Before we had each lesson we had a talk about what we were going to do that day outside. On our first lesson we had our bikes checked and a book given to us about the highway code. When we were on our bikes we were shown what to do when on the road, like how to do a right_hand turn. We then had to practise each new item in the playground. Each day we tackled a new sequence which would help us in the test. The day before the test we went round the course and had a practice run. There was a written test to do before we went on the road. All twelve of us passed the test.
